snippet: The president deplored the “casualness” with which many Republicans have called for war to solve the crisis over Iran’s nuclear program, and challenged his critics to make their case to voters.
abstract: Pres Obama forcefully rebukes Republicans on the presidential campaign trail and in Congress for 'beating the drums of war' in criticizing his efforts to find a diplomatic solution to the crisis over Iran's nuclear program; reminds his critics about the costs and consequences of war; sparring over Iran underscores how squarely the national security issue has entered the election-year debate.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and MARK LANDLER

lead_paragraph: The president deplored the “casualness” with which many Republicans have called for war to solve the crisis over Iran’s nuclear program, and challenged his critics to make their case to voters.

headline.seo: Obama Rebukes G.O.P. Critics of His Iran Policy
headline.main: Obama Scolds G.O.P. Critics of Iran Policy
headline.print_headline: Obama Scolds G.O.P. Critics Of Iran Policy
